channel.title: My customs are invisible in server
channel.description:
well, i added the customs correctly into my client-side, but i forgot how to add the server-side, They show invisible, and don't show anything on character....
anyone help?...
Server is: [DELTA]...
Picture:
[IMG]http://i51.tinypic.com/2qiqzic.jpg[/img]

item.title: My customs are invisible in server
item.dc:creator: @Ddragonimp Ddragonimp
item.description:
@Ddragonimp wrote:

if you dont then i have no idea how to fix it sorry.
i dont code clients
i just pretend.

item.source: My customs are invisible in server

item.title: My customs are invisible in server
item.dc:creator: @Kwia Kwia
item.description:
@Kwia wrote:

[quote=“Ddragonimp, post:2, topic:378090”]your source doesnt matter when its a client issue
Post in Client Help
increase the size of the item i just want ot know if the item exist you just can’t find it

the line to increase it

		class8.anInt181 = 760;// The lower the number the bigger the item

Just lower it down to like 50 or something then resize and such

once you get that right increase number slowly untill you know which direction you need to move it in your inventory.

// class8.anInt181 = 800; // Zoom - Increase to make inv model smaller
// class8.anInt190 = 498; // Rotate up/down - Increase to rotate upwards
// class8.anInt198 = 1300; // Rotate right/left - Increase to rotate right
// class8.anInt169 = -1; // Position in inv, increase to move right
// class8.anInt194 = -1; // Position in inv, increase to move up
Credits go to SilientCJ[/quote]

Didn’t work, if you have teamviewer, or msn add me :3

YouSoBaked@hotmail.com

Read full topic
item.source: My customs are invisible in server

item.title: My customs are invisible in server
item.dc:creator: @Ddragonimp Ddragonimp
item.description:
@Ddragonimp wrote:

your source doesnt matter when its a client issue
Post in Client Help
increase the size of the item i just want ot know if the item exist you just can’t find it

the line to increase it

		class8.anInt181 = 760;// The lower the number the bigger the item

Just lower it down to like 50 or something then resize and such

once you get that right increase number slowly untill you know which direction you need to move it in your inventory.

// class8.anInt181 = 800; // Zoom - Increase to make inv model smaller
// class8.anInt190 = 498; // Rotate up/down - Increase to rotate upwards
// class8.anInt198 = 1300; // Rotate right/left - Increase to rotate right
// class8.anInt169 = -1; // Position in inv, increase to move right
// class8.anInt194 = -1; // Position in inv, increase to move up
Credits go to SilientCJ
